results.title: When the priest came
results.creator_credit: Brianna Smith, Paul Penno, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Paul was taught from an early age to fear the spread of communism. Then the opportunity came to fight it when he was conscripted in the army during the Vietnam war. Initially, it was a lark travelling around Vietnam, visiting villages, but things got serious soon enough. A priest was flown in and soldiers either clung on to their beliefs, or questioned them. Paul’s involvement in the war put him at odds with his father but, having experienced war first-hand, Paul begins to understand why his father felt the way he did.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brianna Smith, Paul Penno, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Why two numbers
results.creator_credit: Jayne Mooney, Noel O'Brien, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The O’Brien family have served in the army since the 1800s. Noel O’Brien, himself a member of the service, delves into the military history of his family and, in particular, of his father. Francis Charles O’Brien had two regimental numbers to his name and Noel wanted to find out the reason. As a result, he discovers something of his father’s personality, a larrikin who got himself into trouble, but was courageous enough to always be there for his mates.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jayne Mooney, Noel O’Brien, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: An Interview with Douglas Margetts
results.creator_credit: Douglas Margetts and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Douglas Margetts served as part of the Australian 6th Division Signals and served in the Middle East and New Guinea in World War II. He relates his experiences as part of “In our words”, a Digital Storytelling workshop for Victorian war veterans.

results.title: When a job becomes a passion
results.creator_credit: John Balsillie, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Major John Balsillie was first posted to Malaya during World War II, he became interested in World War II research and military history. It soon developed into a passion and he shipped off over 20 crates of war relics to the Australian War Memorial in Canberra. He talks of his subsequent visits during the 1960s and the second time he served, in Vietnam. This interest became a lifelong passion for John, for which he was recently awarded an MBE for services to the Australian War Memorial. John sees his role as providing a record of the brave soldiers who gave their lives for Australia.

results.title: Memories of a mate: an interview with Ivor White
results.brief_description: An emotional account by WWII veteran, Ivor White, about his involvement in the war in New Guinea and the tragic circumstances that brought about the death, on 14 July 1944, of his mate Jack Reynolds.

results.title: When war came to Australia
results.creator_credit: Bill Hosking, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A recent visit to Darwin with his son reminded Bill Hosking of the time that war came to Australia. As one of the men who defended Darwin during that time, he was instructed to keep the details of the attack secret. In 1942, Bill Hosking joined up and was shipped up to train in the Northern Territory. It was during this time that the air raids on Darwin took place. Bill shares his experiences because he believes that not many people today know the story of how Australia came under attack.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Hosking, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: A recent visit to Darwin with his son reminded Bill Hosking of the time that war came to Australia. As one of the men who defended Darwin during that time, he was instructed to keep the details of the attack secret. In 1942, Bill Hosking joined up and was shipped up to train in the Northern Territory. It was during this time that the air raids on Darwin took place. Bill shares his experiences because he believes that not many people today know the story of how Australia came under attack.

results.title: An Interview with Allan Couper
results.creator_credit: Allan Couper and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Allan Couper is a Victorian World War II veteran. He served as a pilot in Europe as part of the Bomber Squadron. As part of the Digital Storytelling project “In our words”, Allan relates his experiences of fighting in Europe during the war.

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [May 2009]
results.brief_description: Eleven Victorian war veterans tell about their experiences as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. They tell of their personal recollections of war being declared, signing up and their service during the war as well as remembering those who fought and the symbolism of the Shrine of Remembrance.
results.title_for_label: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [May 2009]

They tell of their personal recollections of war being declared, signing up and their service during the war as well as remembering those who fought and the symbolism of the Shrine of Remembrance.

results.title: Sounds of silence
results.creator_credit: Cliff Richards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: As a Victorian war veteran, Cliff Richards encapsulates his experiences during the war through the various sounds that assailed him. Sounds of helicopters, loud noises and, the one he feared the most, the sound of silence. He considers what the different sounds signify both for him and others and the way the everyday sounds of today can echo the horrors of the past.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cliff Richards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
